page.title: 15SHOPPING CONT.
page.content:
However, many of these items are bought when the islanders go to the mainland. Most households get extra stores by buying in bulk from a wholefood wholesaler in Edinburgh. These orders are sent by post, and often two or three households will combine and share the carriage costs. These goods are sent approximately every two months.
Diesel and calor gas are sent from Mallaig when required. Coal and other heavy or bulky items are sent annually on a cargo boat, chartered by the National Trust for Scotland, referred to as the Puffer. The coal is distributed amongst the households as and when required.
